meanings.definition: Something that is passed down from one generation to another, such as money or property.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother left me valuable inheritances in her will.
meanings.sent2: He received a large inheritance after his parents passed away.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected inheritance made him jump for joy.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an inheritance that enriched everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The inheritance of wisdom is more precious than gold.

meanings.definition: The act of receiving something from someone who has died.
meanings.sent1: The inheritance of the family heirlooms brought tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer handled the inheritance process smoothly.
meanings.sent3: Receiving an inheritance can be bittersweet.
meanings.sent4: The inheritance of memories lingered in the old house.
meanings.sent5: The inheritance of the old mansion was a dream come true.

meanings.definition: The genetic traits or characteristics that are passed down from parents to their children.
meanings.sent1: Her blue eyes were an inheritance from her mother.
meanings.sent2: The study of genetic inheritances fascinated the students.
meanings.sent3: The inheritance of curly hair skipped a generation.
meanings.sent4: His talent for music was an unexpected inheritance.
meanings.sent5: The inheritance of resilience runs deep in their family.
